#labels model,api,class
This class level method creates a new object, saves it to the database (if the validation permits it) and returns it to you.
If the validation fails, the unsaved object (with errors added to it) is still returned.
Attribute names and values can be passed in either using named arguments or as a struct to the `attributes` argument.
Attribute names should correspond to column names in the associated table.

|| *Name* || *Required* || *Type* || *Default* || *Description* ||
|| attributes || no || struct || || attribute name/value pairs ||
|| named argument(s) || no || || || attribute value (the argument name should match the attribute name) ||

*Examples:*

{{{
<cfset new_author = model("author").create(request.params.author_struct)>
}}}

{{{
<cfset new_author = model("author").create(first_name="John", last_name="Doe")>
}}}

See the section on CreatingNewRows for more information and code examples.
